g.text: High resolution transmission electron microscopy image of the SnO
Figure 3a shows the XRD pattern of the SnO
powder, which was obtained from the dried
QDs. Four main peaks of (110), (101), (211) and (112) were observed, in
agreement with the rutile phase of SnO
unit cells were evaluated to be
= 3.18196 Å. The crystallite size of the QDs was calculated to be 2.3 nm
according to the Scherrer’s formula. The size coincided with the grain size observed from HRTEM,
but was smaller than the result of DLS size distribution in Figure 1. The deviation may be ascribed to
the aggregation of QDs, which affected the light scattering during the DLS measurement. The XPS

a shows the XRD pattern of the SnO
powder, which was obtained from the dried

in agreement with the rutile phase of SnO
3.18196 Å. The crystallite size of the QDs was calculated to be 2.3 nm

but was smaller than the result of DLS size distribution in Figure
. The deviation may be ascribed to
the aggregation of QDs, which a
ected the light scattering during the DLS measurement. The XPS
b, which shows the presence of C 1s, O 1s and Sn 3d.
The high solution pattern of Sn 3d shows two peaks of 487.3 eV and 495.6 eV, corresponding to the Sn
, respectively. The spectrumis in good agreement with the standard pattern fromthe

Figure 3a shows the XRD pattern of the SnO
powder, which was obtained from the dried
QDs. Four main peaks of (110), (101), (211) and (112) were observed, in
agreement with the rutile phase of SnO
unit cells were evaluated to be
= 3.18196 Å. The crystallite size of the QDs was calculated to be 2.3 nm
according to the Scherrer’s formula. The size coincided with the grain size observed from HRTEM,
but was smaller than the result of DLS size distribution in Figure 1. The deviation may be ascribed to
